definitions.definition: a person or thing that causes, or may cause, serious damage, harm or danger

examples.text: a new initiative aimed at beating the menace of illegal drugs
The back-bench rebels remain a potential menace to the stability of the government.
Local traders are struggling to combat the menace of armed robbery.
the menace posed by car fumes

definitions.definition: an atmosphere that makes you feel threatened or frightened

examples.text: **a sense/an air/a hint of menace** in his voice
The scar down his face added to his air of menace.
Her eyes were glittering with menace.

definitions.definition: a person or thing that is annoying or causes trouble

examples.text: They have become a public menace.

definitions.definition: threats that somebody will cause harm if they do not get what they are asking for

wordOrigin: Middle English: via Old French from late Latin minacia, from Latin minax, minac- ‘threatening’, from minae ‘threats’.
